comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 3:

Please see the following review using pkgmgr_pkginfo_x pkgmgrinfo_filter_x structures: https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/#/c/30400/

Patch Set 2:

@Sabera: thank you for the link.
Yes, now I see its usage.
However, I still believe, that this structure should be  described/documented (as others are in the pkgmgr-info.h). Additionally, I am concerned about its name. what does "_x" stands for?

Also, I understand, that you are just using some of the fields in this structure...maybe you should introduce then a separate structure, that contains just these fields.

Such approach would reduce dependencies as well (you would not need to include glib or pkgmgr_parser.h headers).

What do you thing about that?

Patch Set 3:

Thank you for the "_x" suffix explanation.

I think, Your proposition about pkgmgrinfo_uidinfo_t would be a cleaner here.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

So for now I am setting "-1".

(2 comments)

Small 2 comments. 
Still, looks good to me.

LGTM, but someone else should approve

subject: install missing tag_parser_list.txt file
commitMessage:
install missing tag_parser_list.txt file

It allows to load some pkgmgr plugins (listed below) when installing an app.
   - shortcut-list
   - livebox
   - account
   - notifications
   - privileges
   - ime
   - font

For example, when installing Settings widget with wrt-installer,
pkgmgr-parser can now load privileges plugin from privacy-manager.
The consequence is that Settings app privacy is inserted in privacy database.

At runtime, Web API access is granted after checking privileges and privacy
in corresponding databases.

Bug-Tizen : TIVI-2617, TIVI-2504/part

Change-Id: If28b0fe6f4041d47b382595a4dd747a9a6203c1c
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>
